X68000 Information

The X68000 is exceptional gem that came from Japan and was released around the same time as the Atari ST and Amiga. There were multiple series of Sharp released. X68000 originally launched in 1987 with 1MB of RAM and 10MHZ 68000 Control Processing Unit with the last series (X68030) including 80MB HD, 4MB RAM, and a 25MHz processor. The earlier models use Shugart Associates System Interface or SASI that was the precursor to SCSI, and most of the pins are compatible in the early drives. The latest models feature a real SCSI drives. These are favored with removable 5.25" floppies where there are few compacts that release only 3.25" drives with smaller cases.

At our website you can find every single ROM from the X68000 catalog which you can load to your favorite emulator and play. Enjoy all your all-time favorite Sharp X68000 games. We have collected altogether a list of 3243 Sharp X68000 ROMs that you can play for free. By the use of Sharp X68000 emulator, you can run all your best-loved games on your Android, iPhones, Mac or PC devices.
